intro: Colymbada lanceolata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved water clover, is a member of the Lentibulariaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous plant that typically grows in moist, calcareous soils near water bodies. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often submerged or floating. Its flowers are small, white or pale pink, and are borne in clusters. Colymbada lanceolata is known for its unique ability to trap and digest small aquatic organisms, contributing to its ecological role in nutrient cycling.
